page.title: 04THE RAILWAY LINE TO TAUNTON
page.content: The mainline railway tracks from Bristol and London,Paddington to the West Country,run through our area.The two tracks meet at Cogload Junction. At the moment three signalmen,working in shifts,control Cogload Signal Box. However,next May this will change as signalmen will no longer be needed.In the interests of efficiency the whole signalling system will be electrified. Instead of signals there will be a system of coloured lights. It's a very busy line.There are local and inter_city passenger services and freight trains.On average,70 trains a day use the track.The freight trains usually travel in the evenings and at night.Two of their main loads are clay from Cornwall and cider from Taunton. This year,to celebrate the 150th anniversary of the Great Western Railway,a few steam trains have run.
